abstract: The All Tomorrow's Parties, the festival that pays lovingly microscopic attention to olden tastes in underground pop from around the world, has relocated its New York-area edition from the Catskills.
snippet: The All Tomorrow's Parties, the festival that pays lovingly microscopic attention to olden tastes in underground pop from around the world, has relocated its New York-area edition from the Catskills.
lead_paragraph: ASBURY PARK, N.J. -- All Tomorrow's Parties, the festival that pays lovingly microscopic attention to olden tastes in underground pop from around the world, started its three-day run last night. It has relocated its New York-area edition to Asbury Park from the Catskills, and this was a life-affirming move. The old place, Kutshers Country Club, is a down-at-heels resort -- the enclosed and remote feeling there made the event feel like a quarantined zone for those afflicted with obscure interests.

headline.main: Festival Starts a 3-Day Run in Asbury Park
